result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Ponce Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The remaining portion of the cash bond from companion Waushara Co Case No. 2015CM000063 in the amount of $68.50 has been applied.  The balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.  DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Ponce Jr.

Def does not wish counsel today.  DA states global resolution has been reached.  Def confirms the resolution recited by the State.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts motion of the State and amends 15CM-63 to FTC DL on Person, contrary to s. 343.18(1) Plea:  NC  15CM-106 Plea Ct 1 (POT):  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Ct 2 of 15CM-106 DRI.  No statement offered by Defendant.  15CM-63 - Court Costs imposed.  15CM-106 Court Costs imposed - 60 DTP or PP.
